page.title: 11The first Ilford Postman
page.content:
{ Postman Chipperfield. About 1863, Chadwell Heath got its {first Sub Post Office.}It stood on the corner of Chadwell Heath Lane and High Road. Nearby there still stands a {Victorian postbox.}George Chipperfield was one of Chadwell's first postmen. He had a big beard and every morning at 7 o'clock he set out on his rounds. Most of his round was over{farmland {and countryside.}It was over 7 miles long and it was lunch time before he got back to the Post Office. People used to look forward to his knock and receiving good news. Up until the second world war, Postman Chipperfield was a well known figure in Chadwell Heath.
